text: The Archaeological Museum of Astros is a museum in Αstros, Arcadia, Greece. It is located in a building which has been used as Karytsiotis school, since the second half of the twentieth century. In 1985, the building was converted into a museum by the Ephor of Antiquities, Dr. Theodoros Spyropoulos. The courtyard of the building was similarly adapted into an archaeological park. ==Interior== The museum contains mostly ceramics from cemeteries dating back to the Hellenistic period, architectural parts of the villa of Herodes Atticus at Eva Dolianon, and small coins, inscriptions and pieces from Kynouria. The museum also contains finds from the ancient town of Anthene. ==See also== * Anthene (Cynuria) ==References== ==External links== * Hellenic Ministry of Culture and Tourism Astros Category:Museums established in 1985 Category:Buildings and structures in Arcadia Category:1985 establishments in Greece
title: Archaeological Museum of Astros
